alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Knott; Lee; Magoffin; Perry; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 10:18PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Perry, northwestern Knott, Breathitt, west central Magoffin, east central Lee and southeastern Wolfe Counties through 1045 PM EDT... At 1018 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Widecreek, or 8 miles south of Campton, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Frozen Creek, Gentry, Vancleve, Wilhurst, Yeadon and Paxton around 1025 PM EDT. Jackson, Simpson, Fivemile, Keck, Elkatawa, Sewell, Taulbee and Moct around 1030 PM EDT. Noctor, Haginsville, Portsmouth, Quicksand, Inverness, Dumont, Haddix, Curt, Rock Lick and Howard Creek around 1035 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Press, Wilstacy, Stevenson, Smith Branch, Rousseau, Flintville, Lost Creek, Clayhole, Bays, Watts, Sikes, Lunah, Camp Lewis, Guage, Daisydell, Hardshell, Lambric, Noble, Decoy and Rowdy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Breathitt; Knott; Lee; Magoffin; Perry; Wolfe
